result.execSummary:
The defendant Maryah M Singleton-Young was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $25.00 per month commencing August 1, 2017; alternate 8 days jail if not paid.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maryah M Singleton-Young

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Menden advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Maryah M Singleton-Young in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State filed Amended Information. State moved to amend to misdemeanor theft, Wis. Statute 943.20(1)(a).
Defendant entered guilty plea to amended charge.
Court found defendant guilty. 

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

FINE: $316.00 to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing August 1, 2017; alternate 8 days jail for non-payment of fine.

DNA SURCHAGE: $200.00 (to be included in the above payment plan).

DNA surcharge and no further charges  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
